p: Our GC-MS results shows that two major compounds, namely hexadecane (18.440%) and heptacosane (15.914%), may harbor insecticidal potential. Further study on the isolation of hexadecane and heptacosane may be useful in identifying the mosquitocidal potential of these compounds ( Table 5). Our findings suggest that A. nilotica hydrodistilled seed oil can control mosquito larvae, and mosquito coils developed using A. nilotica seed pod powder have toxicity against mosquitoes.
